subject: Art & Design
title: The Psychology of Color in Design
description: A 60-second lesson on The Psychology of Color in Design.

hook.text: Facebook is blue. So is Twitter, LinkedIn, and PayPal. Blue signals trust. That's not a coincidence.

buildup.text: Colors trigger psychological and cultural associations: red for urgency, green for safety, yellow for attention.

discovery.text: Color increases brand recognition by up to 80%. The 'right' color can boost conversions by 24%.

twist.text: Color psychology is cultural, not universal. White means purity in the West but mourning in parts of Asia.

climax.text: Coca-Cola red, Tiffany blue, UPS brown ‚Äî these colors are trademarked. They are the brand.

punchline.text: Color isn't decoration. It's a psychological trigger in disguise.

quiz.question: Why do many tech companies use blue in their branding?
options: Blue psychologically signals trust, reliability, and calm
Blue is the cheapest pigment to produce digitally
Blue screens are easier on computer monitors
